info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 12:00AM CDT until April 9 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River At Columbia affecting Maury County.
For the Duck River...including Columbia...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Duck River at Columbia.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Low lying areas along the Duck River and adjacent tributaries continue to be impacted, as well as Riverwalk Park in Columbia. Water begins to cover Old Lewisburg Hwy near Fountain Heights Rd, Howards Bridge boat access, and the Chickasaw Trace Park boat ramp.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 27.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.1 feet early Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
